commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class now accepts user inputs and returns the same input to the
user. When input is "bye", the class will return a different message.

Ducky, previously known as Duke, can now store the text handed to it and
display the text back to the user when they request for it.

To enhance Ducky, next step is to add the ability to mark tasks as done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Task class and updated Duke class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added ducky logo to beautify output.

New Task class was created for handling each task created by the user.

User can now mark their tasks as done, or mark as not done.
Instructions are also given when the user types the "help" command.

Next step to improve the application is to set up the ability for user
to add task type i.e. event, todo, deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: Created Deadline, Todo, Event and Updated Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated 'help' description to include new features that the text that
user can pass into Ducky. Created Deadline, Todo, Event classes that
inherit from the Task class to support task tracking.

Extracted common behavior from the Duke class output to reduce code
duplication. i.e. the long line printed after each run.

Next step is to set up semi-automated testing of Duke class.

Having issues with the Ducky logo, not able to pass the automated tests.
Might be due to spacing error as the test passes without the logo.

More trials to be conducted to ensure Ducky logo can be included

commitResults.messageTitle: Added input.txt file and updated EXPECTED.TXT
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated Ducky logo in Duke.java to remove whitespaces. The whitespaces
were not being caught in the EXPECTED.TXT and should not have been there
in the first place.

Added test cases for all possible inputs (e.g. help, deadline, todo,
event, bye, list, mark, unmark)

Duke had a lot of if else statements being used in the main file. I
split the sections into smaller chunks to ensure that the code is
readable and can be easily cleaned up moving forward. This will also aid
in the exception handling later.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added DukeException, Updated Duke, and Added test cases
commitResults.messageBody:
Added documentation to Duke to showcase the params the methods take and
what it outputs.Exceptions handled include wrong date input format, no
description, no date provided, no proper instructions, and calling an
empty list.

Added more test cases to check on whether he correct exceptions will be
thrown.

Date validity should be checked in each Event and Deadline. Error
should be thrown there to keep Duke code to a minimum.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated Duke with delete functionality and Updated EXPECTED.txt
commitResults.messageBody:
Added delete functionality and exception handling for the functionality.
This includes handling of no index provided and inaccurate index
entered.

Updated the test files to test out the delete functionalities and all
error handling methods are working.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added JavaDocs to Duke, DukeException, and Task
commitResults.messageBody:
JavaDocs are added to all methods within Duke, DukeException, and Task.

Will need to add in more JavaDocs as the code progresses. May want to
also add it for Event, Deadline, and ToDo classes.

Checker class now handles the enum, allowing for switch case use in Duke
to keep the code as tidy as possible. All other functions, such as the
addition of deadlines or todos, still remain the same.

Added a new string to set as the String to be returned when no
description is to be found. Provides ease of change for the future.

JavaDocs needs to be done for the Checker class.

Created a new TextWriter class which handles writing of tasks into a
text file. Added exception handling to Textwriter as well.

New Exception handled in the case where the command Deadline does not
come with "/by" or Event does not come with "/at.

Added two new test cases to check for the new Exception being handled
(i.e. No /at or /by command provided).

Will need to write JavaDocs for the TextWriter class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added date functionality to Deadline and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Created a new class "DateHelper" that helps with converting strings to
Date class. DateHelper stores the dates and can format the date into
the required formats to be outputted in Deadline and Event.

Updated input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT to include the new date formats.

JavaDocs to be updated for DateHelper, TextWriter, and Duke.

commitResults.messageTitle: Completed OOP of Parser, Storage, TaskList, and Storage
commitResults.messageBody:
Edited all files to help keep Duke as lean as possible. Parser is an
enum class that helps to check which command was given. Storage helps
read and write files. Every change in the list will be marked down in
the textfile immediately. Time is also handled in a DateHelper.

JavaDocs to be updated and do error handling for mark and unmark. Mark
and unamrks' error in id passed is not properly handled.

Added Command class which is an abstract class. This class is made to
handle the different commands that could be executed by Ducky. Classes
include:
- AddEventCommand
- AddDeadlineCommand
- AddTodoCommand
- MarkCommand
- UnmarkCommand
- ExitCommand
- ListTaskCommand
- HelpCommand
- DeleteCommand

Packages were also created to add in classes of the same types. Three
packages created were:
- Duke
- Command
- Task
Command and Task are packages under the Duke package.

JavaDocs needs to be completed further.

commitResults.messageTitle: Created JUnit Tests for Ui and Checker class
commitResults.messageBody:
Tested the Checker class to see if it is returning the correct enum
based on the command given into it. Tested UI class methods like
welcome, showLine, showError, and printHelp.

More tests to be created for the other classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added JavaDocs and corrected issue in AddEventCommand
commitResults.messageBody:
AddEventCommand was adding Deadline task instead of Event task, causing
the list generated to be incorrect. Error has since been corrected.

JavaDocs have been added to the code to provide creators with
understanding of each methods' usage.

commitResults.messageTitle: Formatted parts of code to follow coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Formatted comments to be on the top of what it explains instead of
being by the side.

Duke can now find specific tasks that contains the words specified by
the user. It can help the user to quickly search for the task that
concerns them at this point in time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Reformatted code to align with coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Missed out certain formatting areas e.g. spacing after function before
curly brackets. Formatting is now set to the standard required.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Gradle to automate project builds
commitResults.messageBody:
Gradle is now set up and can build and run Duke. To run it, go to
Tasks > application > right click 'run' and run it. This will start the
Ducky CLI.

Gradle can also run JUnit tests. There was an error in the
`./gradlew clean test` initially, where a class could not be
initialized. Error was resolved by changing the Gradle version to 6.4.1.

Ducky now runs on a GUI. All the commands are the same as what it was in
the CLI.

Improvements to be done include:
1. Ducky should welcome the user.
2. Ducky image should be rounded and smaller to give space to the text.
3. User image should be changed to something nicer.
4. Current DialogBox is getting smaller when there are more texts. Issue
can be replicated by typing "help" at every step.

GUI now has the ducky image. User image is also changed to an egg,
which fits with the yellow theme of the application.

Caught errors with the Parser class as it was not catching the case
where the user only mentions the command and nothing else. This was
causing the GUI to become buggy and resolving it was of top priority.

Assertions should be used alongside Exceptions in the classes to further
ensure that there will be no uncaught errors moving forward.

Added assertions to all Command classes and to the TaskList class. The
addition of assertion helps to ensure that the different tasks being
added are not empty. It also ensures that the description of the task is
not empty when passed into the Command classes for task creation. It
also helps to indicate a possible bug in the code as it violates an
assumption about how the code should be performed.

More assertions can be included in the Task classes to ensure that the
created classes have the necessary parameters to perform as expected.

Removed magic numbers and strings to improve readability of the code.
Replaced certain if else conditions with booleans and named them based
on what they are supposed to show. e.g. isEmptyList.

Removed run method in Duke as it was no longer being used. More can be
done to improve the code quality. Some files have not been vetted for
magic numbers and strings

Ducky can now detect inputs such as Monday and Mon to set the due dates
and event dates as the next nearest Monday / day provided.
Upon bye command, the dialog closes in 3 seconds.

When Ducky receives a command that is not part of its intended use, the
dialog box turns bright orange to signal that the user has inputted
something wrongly.
Change SadDucky image to royalty free image.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up unused commands and Javadocs
commitResults.messageBody:
Cleaned up unused commands such as 'getResponse' and added more JavaDocs
 in Ui class. Added more functions to the help command as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit find command and duke error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Ensured that duke's error variable is not accessed directly from
MainWindow. Created a new function to allow MainWindow to access the
error boolean instead.

Find command was faulty and required slight revamp to account for a
missing newline.

User guide now details all functionalities that Ducky provides, and
gives use cases for them as well.
Formatting issues with user guide now accounted for. Added ui image.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add background to GUI and update Ui image
commitResults.messageBody:
GUI of Ducky now has a garden background to fit Ducky's habitat. The Ui
image has also been updated accordingly.

New Ui image now showcases some commands used. Ui is shown in the user
guide as well.
More changes to be made regarding things to expect upon code launch. Might want to consider downloading the JAR file instead of code.
Added UI Image for better preview of the project.
Changed it to user guide information. Updated developer setup information as well.
